I like it because of the high IV (60) in the last few days. Can’t sell puts on single stocks unfortunately because of my job. So 3X index is the next best thing for me.

@options_selling @mommavestor @nyc_lisa @_OptionIncome_ @trader_joemama @JamesLBosse @Dividend_Dollar @business I sold a UPRO put at 139 and the underlying went ITM currently at $137. I got $600 in premium so my true cost if assigned would be $133. If I’m assigned this Friday I will sell 1/21 $142 call collecting ~1k in premium. Decided to “wheel” it as a mgmt strategy

@TeslaAndBitcoin Been doing it for a while with Schwab at 1.5% interest rate. 2 thing to consider 1. As Tesla stock gets more volitile the margin rate can go from 40% (current) to 60% or more. 2. Interest rate is based on the Fed rate and can increase to 6%+

@nyc_lisa @options_selling @isellpremium did the same setup, but used UPRO instead of SPY. I like it because of the higher premiums and lower $$ requirements. Would love to hear your thoughts on it...
@_OptionIncome_ What’s your favorite resource for technical analysis? How did you identify this trade as bullish?
@_OptionIncome_ Buying and selling calls. Do you usually go > 30 delta on the CSPs?

@_OptionIncome_ I guess the only risk here if the underlying decides to turn around and pick the opposite direction. I usually roll at 50% profit, which allows me to release the collateral, regroup and come up with another trade. If it’s at 21 DTE I’ll take an action regardless.

@_OptionIncome_ Makes sense, thanks for the explanation. There’s a constant debate with my greedy self at which point to take the profit. Taking profit at 50% mostly worked out better, but I do get it.
@_OptionIncome_ Curious why you waited for it to expire vs taking profits at 25%-50% ?
